A Rockland-raised inventor appeared on the "Today" show Wednesday morning with his feline-friendly accessory as part of the show's "Next Biggest Thing" competition in the hopes that his product, the Ripple Rug, will be featured on QVC. 
Congers-native Fred Ruckel and his wife Natasha were chosen as finalists in the home, household or pet category for their product, a soft, foldable cat "activity mat," made in the U.S. out of recycled plastic bottles. It's one of three products in the category and was chosen from a pool of approximately 2,000 entries. 
The Ruckels, who currently live in the Catskills, appeared on the show to pitch the Ripple Rug to a panel consisting of QVC's Executive Vice President of Merchandising Doug Howe, "Today" show contributor Jill Martin and Al Roker. 
After the segment aired, viewers had until 5 p.m. Wednesday to vote for their favorite product. Whoever comes out on top will return Friday with other finalists to make a final pitch. 
The winner on Friday will appear on QVC over the weekend to sell their product.
